sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Caleb Olojo)
articles.description: Most users tend to forget their passwords, so create experiences that will always be valuable for people when they use your products. In this article, we’ll discuss how to implement a password-reset feature with Next.js dynamic routes while prioritizing the UX.
articles.title: Implementing A Reset Password Feature With Next.js Dynamic Routes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Evyatar Alush)
articles.description: React popularized context-propagation within applications with the context API. Evyatar Alush brings a brief intro to context propagation in JavaScript and how you can build React Context yourself.
articles.title: An Introduction To Context Propagation In JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: With the “Back” button, users often get confused and frustrated. How to design a better back button UX and where to put those “Back” buttons in our interfaces.
articles.title: Designing A Better Back Button UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Christine Vallaure)
articles.description: Christine highlights some of Figma’s features and possibilities to help you build a design that aligns with code as much as needed and improve your team work.
articles.title: Everything Developers Must Know About Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Chris Simmons)
articles.description: The power of framework-specific UI libraries, such as Skeleton, can lead to more productivity using the combined ability of Svelte and Tailwind to build modern web-based apps.
articles.title: Meet Skeleton: Svelte + Tailwind For Reactive UIs

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: In this article, the first part of “Databases for Front-end Developers” series, Atila Fassina helps you understand the concepts behind database architecture in order to use them reliably and sheds some light on serverless databases.
articles.title: Databases For Front-End Developers: The Rise Of Serverless Databases (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zara Cooper)
articles.description: Identify, compare, analyze and fix your Core Web Vitals scores to boost web performance of your sites. These tools will help you to do just that.
articles.title: Core Web Vitals Tools To Boost Your Web Performance Scores

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we ask how you can affect change to UX design in large organizations stuck in their ways. Vitaly talks to Marko Dugonjić to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 50 With Marko Dugonjic: Can You Change A UX Dinosaur?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Catherine Houle & Ilknur Eren)
articles.description: In this article, Catherine Houle and Ilknur Eren share how their organization “Understood” removes barriers for people who learn and think differently by combining accessibility and usability in their processes. They also cover basic steps on how to fix common accessibility issues.
articles.title: How Our Organization Improved Web Accessibility (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How to improve authentication UX, with magic links, 2FA, better password recovery and relaxed rules for secure, accessible and usable passwords.
articles.title: Rethinking Authentication UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Robbins)
articles.description: We’re going to walk through how to migrate your site from jQuery to [React](/category/React) with [Next.js](/category/next.js). This will help with performance and the maintainability of your code.
articles.title: Migration From jQuery to Next.js: A Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ruslan Yevych)
articles.description: If you like math and CSS, you’ll love this one. We don’t need to use media queries to change the values of some CSS properties — *font-size*, *padding*, *margin* etc. — depending on the viewport width, with the CSS `clamp` function. But: we still need to use media queries for changing colors, borders, shadows and other CSS styles.
articles.title: Fluid Sizing Instead Of Multiple Media Queries?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Do you need a little inspiration boost? Well, then our new batch of desktop wallpapers is for you. Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for August 2022.
articles.title: Memories Of August (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)
articles.description: Testing is not just about tools and processes. It’s about architecture. In this article, Noam Rosenthal will share his experience on how to organize testing and find the right balance between front-end and subsystems and between different strategies.
articles.title: Testable Frontend: The Good, The Bad And The Flaky

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Olushuyi Olutimilehin)
articles.description:
In this article, Olushuyi explores a mental model that helps you decide between the `` and `
` elements when writing documents. You will explore how grouping content affects accessibility and how you can make it all count for users.
articles.title: <article> vs. <section>: How To Choose The Right One

articles.author: Saamer Mansoor

articles.title: How to Implement a GameKit Leaderboard in SwiftUI

articles.title: How to Use Graph Theory to Build a More Sustainable World

articles.author: Bertil Muth
articles.description: Configurable Dependency, also known as Dependency Injection, is a pattern that enables you to switch dependencies of your application. The term [https://web.archive.org/web/20170624023207/http://alistair.cockburn.us/Configurable+Dependency]  was coined by Alistair Cockburn. Say your application has a GUI. But your administrator wants to use certain functions via the console. Or your production code calls
articles.title: How to Refactor to Configurable Dependency in 5 Steps

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: In JavaScript, timestamps are usually associated with Unix time [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time]. And there are different methods for generating such timestamps. When we make use of the different JavaScript methods for generating timestamps, they return the number of milliseconds that has passed since 1 January 1970 UTC (the Unix time).  In
articles.title: JavaScript Timestamp – How to Use getTime() to Generate Timestamps in JS

articles.description: This year I had the honor of speaking at VueConf US 2022 [https://us.vuejs.org/]  and I thought I would share my experience.  Part of this article will cover my personal process, part will look at VueConf specifically, and the rest will be about the conference at large. I hope

articles.title: How to Calculate Percentage in Excel – Formula for Percentages

articles.author: Joel Olawanle
articles.description: Git is a version control system that helps teams and individuals track and record changes made to a file or an entire project. When working with Git, you often commit your changes and then push them to a remote repository. Suppose you have made a lot of commits and later
articles.title: Git Revert File – Reverting a File to a Previous Commit

articles.author: Kolade Chris
articles.description: Discord is a popular chat app for gamers and anyone else who wants to create an online community. Despite its popularity, one major problem users report about Discord is the update failed loop. Discord has to update often because the Discord team implements new features and bug fixes regularly. articles.title: Discord Update Failed – How to Fix the Error on a Windows 10 PC

articles.author: Valentine Gatwiri
articles.description: There are two types of  directives in Angular. Attribute directives modify the appearance or behavior of DOM elements. Structural directives add or remove elements from the DOM. Structural directives are one of the most powerful features of Angular, and yet they’re frequently misunderstood.  If you’re interested in learning more
articles.title: Angular Structural Directive Patterns – What They Are and How to Use Them

articles.description: In this article, I will discuss what code refactoring is. Refactoring means organizing your code without modifying its original functionality. Refactoring is the process
